result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen Coats was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With Case No. 15CF4278, with credit for 25 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.   
*Court orders defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during the period of probation. If revoked, DOC to collect from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *With HUBER privileges for treatment only. Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 3/4/2016 at 12:00 p.m.
*Defendant to complete 250 hours of community service per year during the period of probation.
*To be used at the discretion of the probation officer.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.     

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS. INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEARS 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to Case No. 15CF4278, with credit for 25 DAYS time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION / PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with HUBER privileges for treatment only. Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 3/4/2016 at 12:00 p.m.
-Court IMPOSES and STAYS 90 Days in the House of Correction to be used at the discretion of the Probation Officer.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.   
-Court orders defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during the period of probation. If revoked, DOC to collect from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety
-Defendant to complete 250 hours of community service per year during the period of probation
-Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing Referral Form.

Defendant Stephen Coats in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  


Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report, filed. Per the Court, violation to be addressed on next date.

Defendant Stephen Coats in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for calendar call today.  Court hears bail argument re: recent violation report.  Court withdraws bench warrant imposed and stayed on 1/29/16.  Court orders bail increased by $100 (to $3100, $3000 previously posted on 1/5/16) with turn over to Justice Point.  Defendant taken into custody.  Matter remains scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing on 2/25/16 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Gregory Allan Renden in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for bail/bond hearing re: violation report submitted this morning.  Defense counsel advises the Court that defendant has child care issues and can not appear personally this afternoon.  State requests a bench warrant be issued.  Court hears argument.   Court orders bench warrant IMPOSED AND STAYED until next date.  Defendant to appear in person.  Court to consider State's request to increase in bail at that time.  Calendar call scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
